page.title: 14OUTWARD BOUND ABERDYFI
page.content: The first Outward Bound course ,run in 1941 at Aberdyfi,was to train young Merchant Navy cadets how to handle the demands of armed conflict.During our stay in the village we were fortunate enough to meet an elderly gentleman who had moved to the area as an instructor on these first courses. After the war the Outward Bound Trust was formed to promote 'personal development training'for young people. Located in a large house overlooking the estuary the Aberdyfi centre is famous for its dinghy and cutter sailing and general water activies. Outward Bound Wales in liaison with the village forms the local mountain rescue service, maintains the Aberdyfi Sailing Museum and provids crew for the lifeboat station.
